interlinear-text.item: Wish good and you will get good
MSK baf xoiʃ tsar, baf win [3]

phrase.item: A crow always made a sound of "qar-qar".
And people used to tell [the crow] "die-die".
One day the crow thought and [said to itself], "Will I also hear good tidings anytime?"
Then [the crow] set on a high [place], looked around and saw that a guy arrived from the army.
The crow flew around his house and made sounds.
The owner of the house went outside and was about to get a stone [to throw at the crow], and when he saw that his son was coming, he ran toward his son happily and said to the crow,
It refers to wishing long life to the crow.
The crow got very happy and told the osprey, "If you wish good, the result will also be good".
